replies.bodyText:
The is intentional one line. new throwable().printstacktrace() would give you multiple lines. That is used for true exception logging.
This is not really exception. Just a hint that verify() did not finish in time. We don't want to mix both case for easy reading the test output.
This Arrays.asList is used also in other places in our test.

timeline.message:
fix #1446
Quite some unit test still use Thread.sleep(xxx) to wait for a
condition to happen. This is a source of falkiness of test. This
may also make the test running unnecessarily long. We address
this issue with TestHelper.verify() method.

address another two place lacking assert.
